intro: Stylochaeton salaamicum, commonly known as the Arabian senna, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its botanical study remains limited.
